Build ID: I20071023-0800

Steps To Reproduce:
1. Create an error so that the error log will show a session and the error that occurred.
2. Delete the log.
3. Create another error to produce the exception. The error is never shown in the log view.

Jacek, what are you doing to the log view ;)?

(In reply to comment #0)
> Build ID: I20071023-0800
> 
> Steps To Reproduce:
> 1. Create an error so that the error log will show a session and the error that
> occurred.
> 2. Delete the log.
> 3. Create another error to produce the exception. The error is never shown in
> the log view.

Here's a better description of the test case to reproduce the problem:
1. Self-host Eclipse in debug mode; no need to create a project or check out any code.
2. Produce an error (I use bug 207263, open the Run menu and hover over the items until an error occurs).
3. Delete all the entries in the error log viewer.
4. Produce another error.

When the second error occurs, it isn't shown in the log view. The console of the Eclipse instance running the the self-host will show a stack trace. If the self-host is shut-down and relaunched, the error from the previous session will appear in the log view.

Created an attachment (id=81090)
patch

we should make sure there is a session in log view, before adding anything to it.
